annotations.description: What a thrilling encounter, there was plenty of goal mouth action. Bayern Munich were dominant and more threatening of the two sides. It was a fairly one sided match. The home team played possession football and the away players really focused on a well organized defence.

What a chance that is! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) holds his head in his hands after wasting a promising chance. He latches onto a rebound, creates some space for himself and fires the ball from the edge of the box into the stands.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) sends a pass into the box, but his attempt is thwarted and cleared.

A neat pass is well received by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim), who is lurking on the edge of the box and produces a low drive directed towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Jochen Drees couldn't ignore the rough tackle by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) and blew his whistle.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal bound header towards the left post, but Oliver Baumann pulls off a fine save to deny him.
Referee Jochen Drees sees the trip by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. There is a free kick near the sideline to Bayern Munich.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) attempts a nice header from inside the penalty area, but his effort is blocked.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) will take the free kick.
Holger Badstuber (Bayern Munich) knocks his opponent down with an over the top tackle. Hoffenheim are given an advantage. They have a free kick.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) fires a brilliant shot in from 20 metres out, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
Bayern Munich are showing great team chemistry. They are passing it around beautifully. Excellent team work.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: GOAL! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Oliver Baumann, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:0.

The Bayern Munich players are exchanging fine passes and are waiting for an opportunity to start an attack, but here's a mistake and a loss of possession. The ball is out of play and Hoffenheim manage to earn a corner.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) missed a big chance! He produces a stunning volley from inside the box, but his effort goes not far wide of the right post.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) missed a great opportunity! He finds himself some space near the penalty spot and plants a header goalwards which lacks both power and accuracy. The ball goes well wide of the right post!

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The half time break is over and the second half is about to start.

The players of both teams deserve praise from their managers and supporters for their performance on the pitch. If they continue playing this attractive football, the fans will surely be satisfied. Bayern Munich dominated the opening period and easily created the most chances. The home team makes a lot of passes and attempts to maintain possession. As for the away side, it's obvious that defence has the highest priority for them.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The referee blows his whistle for half time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets on the ball and beats an opponent, but his run is stopped by the referee Jochen Drees who sees an offensive foul.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) receives a pin point pass in the middle of the pitch which gives him a great opportunity to score. He is unfazed by the distance and slams the ball towards the goal. He is unlucky as he hits one of his own teammates.

annotations.label: corner

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Douglas Costa puts the ball across the area and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 1:0.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) sends a low pass from outside the box to Robert Lewandowski. He lines up a shot, but the defence intercepts at the last moment.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) swings in a cross, but the ball is cleared to safety by one of the defending players.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The referee had an easy decision to make. A yellow card is given to Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Jochen Drees blows his whistle for a foul.
What a big chance! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) picks up an inch perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.

Quick reactions by David Alaba (Bayern Munich) and Robert Lewandowski, tricking their opponents with a cheeky chip pass. A beautiful football moment and great skill, which caused the noise in the stadium to go up a notch.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is offside and the linesman raises his flag.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the six yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Oliver Baumann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Jochen Drees blows for a foul.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) releases a powerful first time effort from the edge of the box which goes low in the direction of the middle of the target, but the keeper reacts quickly enough to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping!
Hoffenheim concede a free kick after one of their players holds onto an opposition player.

Jonathan Schmid (Hoffenheim) jumps into a tackle and Jochen Drees blows his whistle for a foul.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
Jochen Drees blows his whistle. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) commits a foul after dangerous play.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Bayern Munich seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. Great movement by the offensive players allows the defenders to set up the attack.

Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the bottom left corner, but it wasn't dangerous and Oliver Baumann made a comfortable save.
